channel.title: Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

item.title: 📣Call To Action📣 Contact Your Denver City Council people...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

📣Call To Action📣

Contact Your Denver City Council people (including At-Large - Ortega & Kniech) and ask:

• What is the status of collective bargaining with Denver Police Dept?...
• Will you commit to allow the police contract to go to arbitration?
• Will you commit to no raises for DPD?

DEMAND - no new raises for Denver Police Department!

A 2-year contract with DPD is not just irresponsible, it is immoral. The current contract allows DPD to lock in a $5M raise in 2022 while no other city employees are allowed to collectively bargain AND face drastic cuts to their agency budgets. The 2021 budget includes minor increases to programs designed as alternatives to policing (STAR, etc.) with funding from external sources – these budgetary increases did not decrease the DPD budget in any way.

Tell your councilperson to stand firm and say NO to this contract!

[image:
-Ortega, At Large 720-337-7713 Ortegaatlarge@denvergov.org @OrtegaAtLarge
-Kniech, At Large 720-337-7712 kniechatlarge@denvergov.org. @KniechAtLarge
-Sandoval D1 720-337-7701 districtone@denvergov.org @sandovalcd1
-Flynn D2 720-337-2222 kevin.flynn@denvergov.org.
-Torres D3 720-337-3333 jamie.torres@denvergov.org @TorresDenver3
-Black D4 720-337-4444 kendra.black@denvergov.org
-Sawyer D5 720-337-5555 denvercouncil5@denvergov.org @DenverCouncil5
-Kashmann D6 720-337-6666 paul.kashmann@denvergov.org @CouncilmanPaul6
-Clark D7 720-337-7777 jolon.clark@denvergov.org @LuckyDistrict7

item.title: Yessenia Martinez is selling tamales & soups this upcoming...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Yessenia Martinez is selling tamales & soups this upcoming weekend! Pickup in Denver, Aurora, and Boulder on November 14 between 1 and 3 PM. Order form: tinyurl.com/solidarity-meals-11-14. Venmo: @Yessenia-Martinez-25

Yessenia has been involved with Sanctuary4All Colorado for the past 2 years and is currently on the S4All board of directors. All funds go to her husband's immigration case. Yessenia is doing this all while raising two small children - and as anyone who has purc...hased a solidarity meal from her before knows, her cooking is delicious!

[image: tamales by the half dozen for $12 - 100% authentic Mexican tamales. Verdes con pollo (filled with salsa verde and chicken), rojos con puerco (salsa roja and pork), rajas con queso (jalapeño and cheese). second image: soups 32 oz for $12 - gluten free. Caldo de pollo (chicken soup with chicken thigh, potato, carrot, rice, and chayote. Sopa de verduras (vegetable soup with corn, carrot, potato, and celery.] Showing Up For Racial Justice - SURJ Boulder SURJ (Showing Up for Racial Justice) Families of Boulder County

See MoreSanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Yessenia is selling tamales and soup for the family next weekend! She’s been involved with Sanctuary4All for over about two years now, is on the board of direct...ors, and has sold pupusas for #SolidarityMeals a few times before. She’s raising money to support her husband’s immigration case. You can place an order at tinyurl.com/solidarity-meals-11-14.

See More
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Today, we are of course relieved that an openly racist,...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Today, we are of course relieved that an openly racist, misogynistic fascist was voted out of the Presidency by the American people, but disappointed in the overwhelming numbers of white Americans who believe the current administration is what is best for this country. We also hold close the reality that if we are to continue the fight for racial justice, we must work harder than ever to hold the Biden-Harris administration, Congress, the Supreme Court, our state and local go...vernments, our neighbors, and our families accountable to the leadership of Black, Brown, and Indigenous communities, most notably the Black women and femmes who, despite their tireless work toward liberation, will be the most adversely affected by harmful policy decisions inevitably to come.

It will also take a tremendous amount of effort to work toward repairing the damage that centuries of racism has caused in this country, let alone that which has been concentrated within the past four years. Our work won’t get easier, it will just look different. We are as committed as always to amplifying the work of Black, Brown, and Indigenous community leaders, and we will never stop striving toward a more antiracist world. We hope you’ll do the same.

See More
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: It's a great day to PAY BLACK WOMXN AND FEMMES. Contribute...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

It's a great day to PAY BLACK WOMXN AND FEMMES. Contribute now. Contribute again tomorrow. Share with your networks.

Celestial Alegría

Pay Black Womxn and Femmes! Make reparations now!

It is no coincide that all of the current #CelestialAlegria #Reparations recipients are Black Womxn and Femmes.... To learn more about each of these incredible Black leaders, healers, artists and organizers go to www.celestialalegria.com/reparations-network

And, be a part of this opportunity to create a system of collective care! I am grateful to have already raised $2,000 because of your generosity, and my goal is to raise $5,000 by November 15th. If I raise more than that amount I will absolutely pay further reparations to more members of our beautiful Black community. But before we get there, I need to show up for the current recipients today!

How you can take action:
Give at Venmo @Celeste-Martinez-129 or PayPal.Me/CelestialAlegria
Share this video with your people
Listen to Black Womxn and Femmes and how they are calling you to take action

https://youtu.be/_cPymDwRqIo
#DefendBlackLives #BLM #BlackLivesMatter #BlackLiberation #ConfrontAntiBlackness #BlackAndBrownUnity #Solidarity #RacialJustice #CollectiveCare #Joy #Transformation #Healing #LifeCoach #Organizer #Leader #Trainer #Consultant

item.title: Denver Police Department, the Department of Public Safety, and...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Denver Police Department, the Department of Public Safety, and Denver City Council Districts 5 & 8 (represented by Councilpersons Sawyer and Herndon) are holding a meeting “to discuss safety and crime in the East Colfax Neighborhood” today - Thursday, November 5th at 5:30 PM on Facebook and Zoom (Zoom registration link here: https://us02web.zoom.us/…/register/WN_YK1tzg48QPez5snL9Di1rg).

Meetings like this, as well as Registered Neighborhood Organizations (RNOs) and DPD Citize...ns’ Advisory Boards are phenomenal opportunities to make our voices heard and advocate for alternatives to policing and disinvestment from policing/investment in community-based programs.

You can:
•Speak up for our unhoused neighbors (who are disproportionately BIPOC) who are harassed and “swept” by police and city agencies repeatedly, have their property confiscated or destroyed, all in violation of CDC guidance to allow homeless encampments to stand because shelters are vectors for transmission of COVID.
•Advocate for continued expansion of programs like STAR (Support Team Action Response) that divert police from 911 calls that involve mental health crises, substance abuse, or people who need connections to services.
•Redirect and question neighbors/attendees who advocate for increased police presence in neighborhoods (see above for alternative solutions).
•Encourage people to engage with neighbors and community members directly in non-emergency situations rather than calling 911.

Do NOT use this to communicate with DPD or the city in ways that could increase policing in the neighborhood. Even if it might seem innocuous (i.e. complaining that your neighbors play loud music late at night) it can make neighbors (particularly BIPOC, unhoused, etc. folks) more vulnerable to police violence.

See MoreWelcome! You are invited to join a webinar: East Colfax Community Safety Meeting. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the webinar.

us02web.zoom.us

item.title: If you can please join this virtual press conference about the...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

If you can please join this virtual press conference about the COVID-19 outbreak at the GEO detention facility in Aurora. Impacted families will speak about their and their loved ones' experiences & you will learn how to act now to pressure our elected officials to act now to stop this ongoing humanitarian crisis. #FreeThemAll #VivosNoMuertos

Hosted by Colorado People's Alliance and AFSC & Coloradans For Immigrant Rights- please follow them to learn more. Even if you can't a...ttend you can:

✅ Call ICE and demand the release of everyone at the detention center on humanitarian parole (720) 873-2899
✅Call Warden Johnny Choate and demand that he provides proper medical care for everyone in need (303) 361-6612
✅ Sign-up to be a volunteer for COPA's Detention Lifeline
email raul@coloradopeoplesalliance.org

Estas son las consecuencias de dejar la salud de las personas en manos de una corporación. GEO no mantiene segura a nuestra comunidad. ¡Necesitamos que actúes hoy!

✅ Llama a ICE y exige la liberación de todos en el centro de detención en libertad condicional humanitaria (720) 873-2899
✅Llama al alcaide Johnny Choate y exige que brinde atención médica adecuada a todos los necesitados (303) 361-6612
✅ Regístrate para ser voluntario de la línea salvavidas para detenidos de COPA envia un correo electrónico a raul@coloradopeoplesalliance.org

See More

MON, OCT 26

GEO Outbreak Emergency-Free Them All! Virtual Press Conference

37 people interested
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Sanctuary4All Colorado would also love it if y'all would...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Sanctuary4All Colorado would also love it if y'all would throw some donations Jorge's way! https://www.gofundme.com/f/keep-jorge-with-his-family

Jorge Araiza has been in sanctuary resisting deportation since December of 2019. Jorge is the father of four U.S.-born children and has lived in the U.S. for 21 years. He grew up in Denver, and practically his entire direct family is in Colorado, including his parents, siblings, and his four children. Jorge's youngest child is four years old, and needs his father.

Since Jorge is in sanctuary, he has limited opportunities to work and needs our assistance raising funds for his new lawyer after his previous lawyer unexpectedly abandoned his case in September. If you can donate please do and please share!

Jorge Araiza has been in sanctuary resisting deportation since December of 2019. He is the fa… Jorge Araiza needs your support for keep jorge with his family

gofundme.com

item.title: Sanctuary4All Colorado solidarity meals for 10/24! This week...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Sanctuary4All Colorado solidarity meals for 10/24! This week Ingrid Encalada Latorre, who has been in sanctuary with her family in Boulder for the past four years, is selling chile relleno ($12), chocoflan ($6.50), and Peruvian masks (available at pickup site).

You can also donate directly to Ingrid through her Venmo or contribute to her gofundme: https://www.gofundme.com/f/continued-support-for-ingrid-and… as she fights to remove the consequences of having previously signed a voluntary deportation order under the advice of her previous lawyer.

Venmo @/Ingrid-Encalada tinyurl.com/solidarity-meals-10-24

Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

Have you heard? Ingrid Encalada Latorre, the founder of @no.mas.chuecos, is selling homemade chile relleno, chocoflan, and Peruvian masks this Saturday to raise... money for her legal case. Ingrid has been in sanctuary now for about four years as she fights her immigration case so that she can stay in the U.S. with her children. She received a pardon from @govofco last year, in large part for her work with @no.mas.chuecos, which seeks to educate immigrants about the dangers and consequences of uses false documents. You can support Ingrid as she fights to stay in the U.S. by purchasing food from her this weekend or by donating directly to her Venmo @/Ingrid-Encalada tinyurl.com/solidarity-meals-10-24.

See More

item.title: Virtual town hall “Race on the Ballot: Using a Racial Equity...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Virtual town hall “Race on the Ballot: Using a Racial Equity Lens to Inform Your Vote" is starting soon at 4:30PM! Please register in advance at this link: http://bit.ly/raceontheballot

About the event:
Denver has more than 20 initiatives on our ballot this election season. Some of us wonder how our votes on these initiatives will reflect racial equity, an issue of critical importance to many in our community. "Race on the Ballot: Using a Racial Equity Lens to Inform Your Vo...te" will bring together panelists, each of whom will discuss a ballot initiative through the lens of racial equity. The goal of this virtual event is to inform and empower participants to use a racial equity lens when interpreting their ballots. This is a community educational opportunity to raise our collective social consciousness for the 2020 election and beyond.

The panelists are as follows:
- Dr. Apryl Alexander, Associate Professor at the University of Denver, an organizer with Black Lives Matter 5280, and a board member for the Colorado Juvenile Defender Center will speak about Proposition 115 (banning abortion after 22 weeks of pregnancy).
- Representative James Coleman, Colorado State Legislator and Executive Director of FaithBridge, will speak about the Gallagher Amendment, which relates to property taxes.
- Iman Jodeh, Executive Director of Meet the Middle East, Community Advocate and Liaison for the Interfaith Alliance of Colorado, and candidate for Colorado House District 41, will speak about family leave.
- Representative Adrienne Benavidez of House District 32
- Imam Abdur-Rahim Ali, leader of the Northeast Denver Islamic Center, will speak about an initiative of his choice.

Rev Amanda Henderson, Executive Director of the Interfaith Alliance of Colorado, will moderate this event.

Current event partners and co-hosts:
Cameron Church's Good Trouble initiative
COLOR (Colorado Organization for Latina Opportunity and Reproductive Rights)
Curious Theatre Company
Emancipation Theater Co
The Interfaith Alliance of Colorado
Mountain Sky Conference of the United Methodist Church
Progress Now Colorado
Sacred Stones Ministries
Scott United Methodist Church
Showing Up for Racial Justice (SURJ) - Denver
Soul2Soul Sisters

See More

secure.everyaction.com

Race on the Ballot
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Supporting Black educators is critical.
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Supporting Black educators is critical.

Black Lives Matter 5280

#CTA #Calltoaction Black afternoon fam and friends! Don't know about y'all, but we are still in our feelings about the lack of Black nominees for #ColoradoTeach...eroftheYear. From your shout outs we put together a list of 32 Black educators in Denver and Aurora that deserve all the props for their #Blackeducatorexcellence! We're excited to share that BLM5280 is pledging to honor their general dopeness with a $50 award to each nominee BUT if we can get 160 of y’all to give just $10 we can double that and send each educator $100! Send your contribution at the link below and be sure to label it ‘#BlackEducatorsMatter’.

www.venmo.com/BLM5280

Like, share, and comment 'done!' so this post doesn't get buried! ✊🏿✊🏿✊🏿

See More
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: Our friends at Denver Alliance for Street Health Response have a...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

Our friends at Denver Alliance for Street Health Response have a series of offerings to prepare all of us for the next few weeks and the weeks and months that follow. These include protest safety and first aid (October 21), mutual aid (October 22 and 27), Legal Observer Training (October 24 and 29), and Community Defense (October 28).

Please go to their page for more details on how to register for these events and as always if you can support DASHR's ongoing work please donate: https://www.gofundme.com/f/supporting-dashr039s-community-r….

Denver Alliance for Street Health Response

Join DASHR, Colorado Jobs with Justice/Trabajos con Justicia and community partners for a series on Democracy Defense and Community Resistance. So far 2020 has ...been full of crises for working people, including the COVID-19 pandemic, economic crisis, ongoing white supremacy, climate chaos, and more. As we head into a very contentious election – we should plan for what could feel like more chaos. There are a number of scenarios on election day, and more importantly in the days after the election.

See More
item.author: SURJ Denver

item.title: You are invited to attend a virtual town hall about “Race on...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

You are invited to attend a virtual town hall about “Race on the Ballot: Using a Racial Equity Lens to Inform Your Vote" on Wednesday, October 21, from 4:30-6 p.m. Please register in advance at this link: http://bit.ly/raceontheballot

About the event:
Denver has more than 20 initiatives on our ballot this election season. Some of us wonder how our votes on these initiatives will reflect racial equity, an issue of critical importance to many in our community. "Race on the Bal...lot: Using a Racial Equity Lens to Inform Your Vote" will bring together panelists, each of whom will discuss a ballot initiative through the lens of racial equity. The goal of this virtual event is to inform and empower participants to use a racial equity lens when interpreting their ballots. This is a community educational opportunity to raise our collective social consciousness for the 2020 election and beyond.

The panelists are as follows:
- Dr. Apryl Alexander, Associate Professor at the University of Denver, an organizer with Black Lives Matter 5280, and a board member for the Colorado Juvenile Defender Center will speak about Proposition 115 (banning abortion after 22 weeks of pregnancy).
- Representative James Coleman, Colorado State Legislator and Executive Director of FaithBridge, will speak about the Gallagher Amendment, which relates to property taxes.
- Iman Jodeh, Executive Director of Meet the Middle East, Community Advocate and Liaison for the Interfaith Alliance of Colorado, and candidate for Colorado House District 41, will speak about family leave.
- Representative Adrienne Benavidez of House District 32
- Imam Abdur-Rahim Ali, leader of the Northeast Denver Islamic Center, will speak about an initiative of his choice.

Rev Amanda Henderson, Executive Director of the Interfaith Alliance of Colorado, will moderate this event.

item.title: White folks who are taking to the streets in solidarity, are...
item.content:encoded:
Showing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

White folks who are taking to the streets in solidarity, are your actions and decisions centering Black, Indigenous, and People of Color? This document provides guidance on how to prioritize the vision of BIPOC organizers, tips for keeping safe during actions, and direction for white accomplices acting in a security/marshal role. This document also includes BIPOC led organizations doing amazing work in Colorado.

https://bit.ly/2Mnw0Nd
